page.title: 16LOCAL POET- PETER BUCHAN
page.content: Peter Buchan, our local poet was born in Jamaica Street in 1917.As a boy he hated doing mathematics, but loved poetry. He was a fisherman for 30 years.When he was 30 years old, he started to write his own poems and he became a poet. He has had 5 versions of his book 'Mount Pleasant' published.He lives in a house also called 'Mount Pleasant', which over looks the harbour. Peter Buchan's first poem was 'Days Gone By' and his most recent poem is 'Where There's Life'. He has written 68 poems to date. He gets his ideas for poems by watching, listening and talking to people. He always writes in local dialect. Although retired, he still goes fishing in his own boat, but his first love is poetry.
